website_summaries.verdict: The wisely designed Asus ZenScreen Touch brings touch-input capability, flexible stand options, and an on-the-go internal battery to a 15.6-inch mobile monitor, topping the field.
pros: Comprehensive, easy-to-navigate menus, with mini-joystick for navigation
cons: Limited touch support for use with Macs, and none for iOS devices

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in September 2017. I saw a few reviews stating that it works for a few months and then stops working. The majority of the reviews on Amazon were positive. Reviews outside Amazon were also positive. They all outweighed the negative reviews. It is now April 2018 and guess what, it does not work. It was working last week on my Macbook but this week no joy. I have reinstalled the latest EZLink driver, still nothing. I have tried different leads, nada. Take my advice, along with the advice of others, it stops working after a few months with no explanation on any forum as to why.
customer_reviews.author: The Time-Lord

customer_reviews.title: slight lag
customer_reviews.text: Resolution and display are excellent but two things: 1) There is a slight lag, if you're doing detailed graphics work, you'll find it annoying. For most office work, no problem. And just to cover off, I've a top of the range laptop i7 SSD etc so it's not a hardware issue. 2) When they say metallic finish, what they mean is a "sticky-back plastic with a metallic pattern printed on it but we'll call it metallic and see if the suckers notice". Still, does the job. Mostly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike CW

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Portable Monitor - light, great connections, and includes high quality case/stand
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It works great combined with a tablet stand as a portable monitor. You can use the provided case stand which is great, but I need everything elevated for neck pain, so as you can see by the photo, this can easily be done with a tablet stand as the monitor is so light! I regularly take this all over from co-working spaces to cafe's and its amazing the number of people who comment on the setup and ask where they can buy the hardware. I should be on commission but sadly im not!
customer_reviews.author: Pep'n'Pop

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel and Covid-19 lockdown
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor for travel, having to work at family members and prefer double screens, so this does the job but is still easy to carry. Having to use hdmi slot for older company laptop without usb 3. 0 port then USB cable keeping it charged. Works well apart from when laptop hibernates and on resume, have to unplug the replug the USB, to remove a ghost 3rd screen in monitor which makes the mouse disappear! Apart from that software glitch which is likely the laptop not the monitor its great to use. Would give it 4.5
customer_reviews.author: Simon W

customer_reviews.title: Great display, Weak cable, Shockingly bad service
customer_reviews.text: The cable this comes with (which is basically one of a kind, being USB-C DP Alt mode) is incredibly poorly made, and in the year or so I've owned it, I've gone through three of them. The worst part is the customer support Unresponsive, unhelpful, and I basically had to fight my way to get anywhere with them, which is crazy for such a big company like Asus. Given there are alternative monitors that use DisplayLink over USB, allowing for significantly more versatility, I just can't suggest this product, even if you're careful.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Random flickering developed after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: This was great when I bought it. Worked well with my 2018 MBP - via supplied usb-c cable. Bought a usb-c to usb-a cable to try and make it work with an older Mac Mini - couldn't get that to work. No problem there. However in the last 3 weeks it has started flickering. Perhaps every couple of minutes. So this is disappointing. I haven't used it loads, I haven't moved it around much. But really disappointing that it is now almost unusable. ASUS - is there a warranty? Can I get it replaced?
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T. Attwood

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: Good for my specific uses as a portable device when I don't have available power pros: works with Linux displaylink driver (Tested ArchLinux x64). Convenient product if you don't have a lot of power to throw around. cons: Screen quality poor I cannot get screen brightness adjustments to work (tested in Windows 10 x64 + Linux). ASUS Windows driver left in "we promise we will update this" state where disabling the brightness setting crashes the windows control software due to a missing/broken DLL somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great option for flexible working with a laptop
customer_reviews.text: Given the extended period away from the office, I was looking for options to be flexible in where I could work. But in my home office I have a large second screen which makes a huge difference when working with a mid-size laptop. I bought this screen to resolve this problem and it has proved to be a good choice. Very easy to use, with single USB-C cable (supplied) which can also be used in a USB3-A socket for laptops without USB-C, using the supplied adaptor. Bright, sharp screen which seems easy to use for extended periods. Useful cover supplied with it which clips over the front for transport and forms a stand when the screen is in use.
customer_reviews.author: Eoin Woods

customer_reviews.title: Terrible resolution
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to keep this product but I just couldn't. The resolution was like something from 2001. I will take part of the blame as if you look at the reviews, they are all pretty old which I didn't notice. Also there is multiple products in this listing, including the newer machines so the reviews are not entirely reflective. I purchased the ASUS MB168B. Neat and compact, but couldn't cope with feeling like I was on Windows 98.
customer_reviews.author: MISS MR CHRISTIAN

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for a Colleauge and they loved it so much that I was requested to purchase more
customer_reviews.text: I was asked to purchase this for one of my Work Colleagues, it arrived one day after ordering and was very well packed, I am unable to comment on the build or use as it was for someone else however what I can say is that she clearly loved it so much she recommended it to 2 another colleagues, and as a consequence I have now purchased two additional units for them also and hence the 5 star review and will probably be asked to order further units for my team going forward
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No use for phones :-(
customer_reviews.text: A lovely screen but such a shame it has only one USB-C port as it's no use for Samsung phones in Dex mode as it drains the phone power in no time (understandable). It doesn't activate Dex either (but that could be a simple hardware/software fx). All they have to do was add a second power port and it would make a brilliant travel companion for Samsung Phones to turn them into full desktop devices (+keyboard/mouse). PLEASE asus - add a second power/PD port !
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Requires firtling
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice screen. I've added it to my desktop PC setup to keep email etc off the main screens. USB wasn't quite as plug and play as I'd hoped. I have a USB keyboard/mouse combo in a USB 2 port. When I connected this screen to a USB 3 port, the keyboard stopped working. Mouse was okay. After some trial and error, and to my surprise, if the screen and the keyboard/mouse are plugged in to the same USB 3 4 port hub, everything is fine. Odd, but there it is.
customer_reviews.author: Chuffed

customer_reviews.title: Consumes soo much energy so keep you laptop connected to electricity
customer_reviews.text: It is dark. Not bright enough. And usb c model does not have a hole and pen you have to use the cover. I don't like It much. The product is very useful. As a remote working developer I can work at hotel lobbies, visiting offices et. With second screen. Not very heavy and work perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tugrul Karakaya

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but took time to get the colours how I like them
customer_reviews.text: The display is very nice. Can use Bluetooth sound if connected to note 10 phone But not with apple device. BUT there is a headphone jack. Case is Cr*p. Not good as a stand. A GOODb travel/table top tripod is much cheaper than the one that comes with the kit.. Didn’t go for tripod included. Happy so far.. The weight show in descriptipton is GROSS weight of package. Well boxed for safe delivery
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. Works perfectly and the cover is pretty effective. I tried to buy a braided USB-C cable, but it was not the right type to charge and transmit video, so check the exact cable specification needed. The cable supplied obviously works very well, but is not as flexible as I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works on Linux with some tweaks and only minor issues.
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my Linux laptop. I used it at the Inkscape Hackfest recently and it was very useful. Please keep up your DisplayLink Linux support, and fix the v-sync fps issue to help adoption (contact me for details). I'm replacing my desktop monitors with these. They consume 1/3rd the energy and so are greener than just about anything you can get at full HD. Well done on an excellent product! -C
customer_reviews.author: C.M.Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome screen but faulty item recieved
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this monitor but I've had to give it a 2 star bec when I got it, it only charged to a maximum of 76%. I tried leaving it on charge for 3 days without me using at all and believe not using was hard...after 3 day's it still won't go to 100% charge. For me it's a fantastic screen, I use it to run Samsung Dex and its absolutely awesome but alas I reluctantly need to return it and now i have to wait for a new one to arrive which I hope will charge to 100% and then I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Portable with very clear screen
customer_reviews.text: My second screen has dramatically improved my productivity. My main reason for making this choice was that I could carry it around to the Library with my laptop without feeling the weight. People gave negative reviews of the dullness of the screen but I realized I could adjust it from the side and it is very clear and bright. I can suggest making the settings more user friendly and with a manual to show new buyers how to set it up. I had to use you tubes and asked questions to set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Ukamaka

customer_reviews.title: This does not work on the MacBook Pro!
customer_reviews.text: I was prepared to have to use an adaptor to convert the USD 3.0 to the MacBook Pro's USB type C port, but I wish that this product clearly stated that it is not currently compatible with the new MacBook or the MacBook Pro! After an hour of trying to set this up, I found this fact at the bottom of the specifications page of the Asus website. This monitor is being returned today- it's a shame because it had such potential!
customer_reviews.author: Velma

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work but great ASUS helpdesk
customer_reviews.text: Great concept - neat, portable screen - but couldn't test it in real life. The screen didn't work. Crashed my HP Elitebook several times in the process of trying to connect it. No green light when toggled to 'on'. ASUS Helpdesk super quick to answer and very helpful. Return was easy. Sadly didn't order a new one as the price has since gone up ... COVID-19 demand induced price surge??
customer_reviews.author: Nicola H

customer_reviews.title: brilliant screen
customer_reviews.text: I needed a screen for my laptop in about the same size. This slim screen is great allowing me to work with 2 screens using minimum space and no extra power socket required. Just plug in, wait a few minutes till windows 10 works it out and bang new screen. I am very pleased despite the fact that it does not come cheap, it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: andief

customer_reviews.title: Needs 7.5Watts power via USB-C
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work with my Google Pixel Slate since the USB-C port can't produce enough juice. Tried powered USB-c adaptors/hubs but they have same issue. Might work with the larger docking station type hubs which defeats the object of this portable screen if you need to pay an extra £100 & lug around a huge extra brick. Not the screens fault, so given it 4stars since looked good with a Mac.
customer_reviews.author: gdv

customer_reviews.title: Think carefully what you use it for and where you use it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a second monitor for my laptop. Something I could easily hide away at the End of a working from home day. Part of my job involves sharing a desktop remotely to support my colleagues. Useless. Way too small to use. You need to be using it at about the same distance as your laptop screen. Not great on brightness or contrast. I don’t use it now.
customer_reviews.author: Les Ross

customer_reviews.title: Not fully compatible with Surface Pro
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this monitor can only be used at about 70% brightness with the Microsoft Surface Pro, as any higher can't be handled by the single USB port, causing the monitor to continuously reboot. When using a USB hub, Surface Pro is unable to power 2 of these monitors simultaneously due to lack of power. The description said these are compatible with any laptop with a USB port, so I am dissatisfied with the reality of the situation. ASUS should outline minimum power requirements for full featured use.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Farrelly

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this screen as soon as lockdown started. I have been using it 5 days a week, 8 hours every day. So far, no issues with it. It is also super light and easy to manouver. It is really good for the price. Now, I wouldn't use it as a MAIN screen, just a side screen, due to the limitations of colours and brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really meet the standard of being portable
customer_reviews.text: i bought this thinking i could ravel with my work laptop and have a portable 2nd screened the problem was the stand, the picture very misleading and its doesnt balance the screen very well and i can see this easily being knocked over and broken. Doesn't really meet the criteria of being portable if you can stand it didnt try the product after noticing this doesn't stand well, bit of a waste of time opening this to find out the major flaw
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good...but does not work on Minix style mini PCs
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, mine went back because they don't tell that these screens need more power via the USB cable than can be delivered by mini PCs like Minix etc. There are work arounds, but that means more cabling and expense that rather defies the point of this screen. If you're using on a suitably powered PC, you won't have any complaints because it's a very good, stylish screen. Completely portable too. Just a shame that it's limited in terms of power.
customer_reviews.author: Meg50

customer_reviews.title: We actually own three MB16AP's now..
customer_reviews.text: Yes, they are that good! One I actually bought via SCAN (higher price) :( The other twice here on Amazon, slightly cheaper. Screen is super clear, bright and a 4 hr battery that actually lasts 4 hours! Great on-screen features/options, screen rotation possible and a lovely cover that doubles as a stand too!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not the sharpness I expected
customer_reviews.text: Being Asus had high hopes, alas the USB version is not crystal clear, and does not align with my Lenovo laptop screen when dragging across, so fonts increase. The screen size is not standard, so when dragging a window from laptop to screen, loose the bottom half and have to reshape. As a temp screen fine, if I was hoping to use more often, not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Dogcoat

customer_reviews.title: a great monitor for users 'on the go'
customer_reviews.text: Really surprised about the overall quality of the monitor. Color temperature, contrast and brightness are very good and viewing angle is great. this is now part of by home/mobile setup and it worked straight out of the box with both my MacBook Pro 16" 2019 (Mac OS Catalina) and my Dell Inspiron 13 7000 (Windows 10). only notable (minor) problems are: - the usb-c connector is a little bit wobbly even though the cable is properly plugged. i suggest to keep the monitor still and to avoid moving it too much. - the controll wheel/power switch seems quite delicate. luckily once set up there's no need to touch it often. Great product, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible with Mac Pro
customer_reviews.text: There just isn't any clear lists anywhere online of what this monitor is compatible with. After extensive research I couldn't find any documentation to say it wasn't compatible with a Mac Pro Desktop computer so i purchased it. When i use it with a USB-C to USB 3 connector i get the Asus logo come on the screen and not much else but really surprisingly when i run it from a thunderbolt port on the Mac Pro using an apple Thunderbolt to USB-C adaptor i get absolutely nothing! just a message on my mac pro screen saying Accessory needs more power. Very disappointing, why would it not be compatible with Thunderbolt???
customer_reviews.author: Mr N.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Very good product, works as expected. Unfortunately I found it impossible to hook up 2 USBC displays to my work PC so had to send one back, but am very pleased with the purchase. Flicker-free, good brightness, not quite as sharp as my main PC display (hence 4 stars for picture quality) but really very satisfactory. Super easy to set up. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A. Peterc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable monitor
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is astoundingly good. I can't quite get it at the perfect angle, but it does a good job in the folio case it comes with. Brightness is, as reviewed, a little lacking, but in anything other than direct sunlight that isn't a problem. SO easy to use, and you can use Mac settings to use it in portrait mode, even though it can't autorotate for Mac. Single wire connection, less than 3 seconds to connect and focus, and it fits into my 13" laptop bag. Well worth the money, wish I had had this for longer.
customer_reviews.author: F M C Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: A good item if you have a particular need.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, basically plug and play as windows automatically downloads the drivers. The screen is nice and gets plenty bright for indoor use, no complaints there. Doesn't feel that sturdy, I'd be very careful if you plan to carry it in a bag everyday. There is noticeable screen lag, so be aware of that. Could also be cheaper, £180 is a lot for what is essentially the screen off a laptop with some additional circuitry. It's a niche product, which is no doubt the reason for the high price. A good item if you have a particular need.
customer_reviews.author: K. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Truly portable monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent investment for a truly portable screen as it powers on through the USB port. Great quality resolution and brightness. It is really sleek and the screen cover cum stand works just the way it should. Really happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mobile second screen.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous way to have a portable second screen for a laptop! Great for home working, in the COVID-19 Environment! Will be using it when working away from home in future! Lots of settings for the screen. Can plug it in to your smartphone and play videos from it. Very practical.
customer_reviews.author: G Deasy

customer_reviews.title: Great extra monitor for work trips
customer_reviews.text: This is a great plug and play monitor that I have found very useful to take on work trips to work on excel documents, etc. Very light weight and slim so easily packed away with laptop. It comes in different resolutions and I opted for one of the less expensive ones. Still very pleased with it, and so are my eyes on long travel days when I need to work from my hotel room.
customer_reviews.author: Cecily

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The screen is fairly good. it consumes lots of battery if working from the laptop without being connected to electricity. the quality os the screen if good (not exeptioanlly) and is a good investment for a second laptop screen. No connectivity rpobelms with my macbook pro.
customer_reviews.author: PEDRO P. CARDSO

customer_reviews.title: Additional screen with no power cables required
customer_reviews.text: Plug and Play USB-C monitor. Works without any additional setup on my Macbook Pro. Good screen quality and sharpness, and plenty bright enough. Has a number of other settings including one to protect your eyes, if like me you get paid to stare at screens for hours! Very lightweight and portable, comes with a protective sleeve that doubles as a stand (although I use my own).
customer_reviews.author: Mr A

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for Samsung DeX users.
customer_reviews.text: Monitor's power requirements are too high for just the phone (Samsung S10 Plus) to power it. Only has one USB-C port to cover both power and input. Also had bought a 20100mah power bank knowing this would be an issue, however even with a USB-C hub there's no way to transmit input and power simultaneously. Would recommend to any DeX users to search for a monitor that has separate power and input ports as this would eliminate the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Paddy

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for mobile workers used to multiple screens.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is fantastic. I use it all the time on my laptop whilst im working on client sites. Needs no external power, and runs without needing to manually install drivers on Win10. Have also tested on Win7 computers after installing the Displaylink drivers, and worked fine there too. Despite being USB3, this screen will work in a usb2 port, as long as the port supplies enough power (you may need a "Y" cable on older machines to supply additional power)
customer_reviews.author: Karl Tremain

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works perfectly, brilliant in portrait mode for additional desktop area
customer_reviews.text: Really really cool. I'm a software developer, and took a working/studying holiday for 5 months, travelling to different places. The pros: - very light - brightness is very good - no lag (I was using it mainly for watching video tutorials while coding on my laptop screen) The cons: - the stand (which is the case)- as a case it's fine, but as a stand in portrait mode the screen sits back a bit at an angle. It's just a rubbish stand (think the newer models have a better one)
customer_reviews.author: B_Island

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I only recently discovered this bit of kit!
customer_reviews.text: A screen which doesn't need mains power - get out of here!!! Didn't believe it till I tried it! now everyone at work wants one too!! i work remotely ALOT! This is such a simple concept which boggles my mind I've not done this sooner (I used to take a full size screen with plug around with me!) this one just fits in with my laptop bag!
customer_reviews.author: Juju

customer_reviews.title: Works straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: While this definitely isn't the best second screen option, as a mobile addition to a laptop setup, it does exactly what it says. I hooked it straight up to my MacBook Pro which immediately added it as a second screen. The resolution is adequate for reading and watching video. For editing I still use the Macbook Pro screen for the main view and the ASUS for the ancillary views. I have just received this so will need to play a little more to match colours as best as possible etc. but on unboxing and first use I am very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Bettell-Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Breaks down after a few months. Non-UK third-party supplier making the warranty void. Good while it works
customer_reviews.text: I bought it four month ago and it has just stopped working. After reading another review that has been posted about the product from this supplier getting no reply and no replacement (ASUS saying the supplier is outside the UK making the warranty void). Reading else, the monitor stopping working after a few months is a common. I realise it is cheap & you don't need an expensive graphics card if you want several of them running at the same time. However, you will be paying more over the long run. i.e. it will be a bit like paying a subscription every few months
customer_reviews.author: Ready Steady

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. Poor value for money
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says on the tin. A nice quality and feel to the screen although the pen provided is not interactive which is why I bought the more expensive model. Some improvements would be better settings for battery use and why does it not auto power off the device it plugs in to when there is a power source??
customer_reviews.author: Danny O'Keeffe

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful portable HD monitor!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is currently being used with my NAS server since it didn’t work on my GPD Win device despite it incorporating MiniHDMI. Nether the less , found a use for this and it works fantastically! All off USB power , no need for an outlet to use this which is a big plus for me. Something that must be said however , is ASUS’s support website is shocking - and pops up with different model names to this one. Be careful when downloading drivers and software for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Milan Cosens

customer_reviews.title: Amazing second monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a second portable USB monitor for months to use whilst I'm working from home. This works wonders on both my Windows Laptop and Macbook Air! To use on Mac OS, you just need to install a driver from the ASUS website (super quick and easy) and you're good to go! The picture quality is not jaw dropping however, I only bought this second monitor to help me view documents for work and school and works wonders! The size is perfect and its very light and thin. Would definitely recommend to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but let down by screen being too ...
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but let down by screen being too dim - should be able to power separately. Also a bit small. Stand is a bit amaturish, and takes up to much space on the desk. Was tempted to keep it, but opted to return and swap for the only-slightly-more-expensive HannsG, which is touch screen but a lot heavier. Positives: Very light, comes with a case. USB works well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Horridge

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in everyway.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as I needed an extra screen for my macbook pro as I didn't really have the room for an extra monitor. I was not dissapointed, this monitor works perfectly and couldn't be easier to use, has hardly any noticeable lag and after calibration is very close to my macbook retinas clarity.
customer_reviews.author: mr.Robot

customer_reviews.title: Great for work!
customer_reviews.text: I constantly travel for work and need two screens. I decided to give these a shot and was pleasantly surprised. A few cons I can think of are that the brightness is not adjustable on Windows 10 and that can be a problem. Also, the "stand" that it comes with does not hold the monitor up very well and it takes a lot of desk space.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on most Windows laptops, Apple only really.
customer_reviews.text: I only managed to get it to work on Apple. You need USB 3.1 Thunderbolt 3 on the laptop as far as I can see, almost no Window laptops have. They really should sell this as a windows monitor. It gets its power thru USB type C, which Windows machines do have and there not connector that will work with. I don't think even USB hubs work with it.
customer_reviews.author: William Davison

customer_reviews.title: MB169B+ Good screen, awful case/stand
customer_reviews.text: Work well with Lenovo T480 with Win 10 when connected to USB 3.0 port or USB-C port via an adaptor Works with older Toshiba Z930 with Win 10 when connected to the "sleep & charge" USB 2.0 port. It doesn't work when connected to the USB 3.0 port. Plug & play with Win 10. Brightness is good and it is like any monitor. It has a physical brightness button on the side and an on/off button. The case is OK as a case, although it adds bulk. It is useless useless as a stand, hence taken a star off.
customer_reviews.author: George M

customer_reviews.title: A good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Like many, people working from home just now. This screen was purchased to supplement a lap top. It has been a good purchase - small enough when not in use big enough when needed. Recommended! Great delivery service too!
customer_reviews.author: Steps-59

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good monitor. Instructions are awful. Enclosed USB driver stick doesn't work. Out the box settings poor but with work you can get good picture. Not a finished product
customer_reviews.author: spellfast

customer_reviews.title: Slows down MacBook
customer_reviews.text: Screen quality and resolution are disappointing when sat next to Retina display. However the main problem is that using this screen noticeably slows down my 2018 MacBook.
customer_reviews.author: R. Howarth

customer_reviews.title: If you're considering it, just do it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for going back to University and now I can't image ever using my laptop without it. It's absolutely Brilliant! Light weight, clear and bright screen but can easily be dimmed. Quick to install and easy to use each time. Also is more tough than I expected it, surviving living in a university rucksack and constantly on the move. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Tsurugi-ijin

customer_reviews.title: Additional requirements needed for surface pro
customer_reviews.text: Good easy to use portable monitor. Would not be my first choice if I working in a fixed position. The key is portability. Drawbacks is need power for it work with surface pro as the battery mode is not powerful enough.... A split USB cable rectified this with a further extension.... Once done it is good enough for spreadsheets....
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Whitfield

customer_reviews.title: works excellently as an external monitor, brightness levels don't adjust though initial setup a bit complicated.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good piece for programming with. I would recommend it. However I had to find the drivers for it online as it comes with a cd and who on earth has a cd drive in their laptop anymore? The carry case it comes with is great for transport but really not reliable as a stand so do buy a little stand for it too. The only real con is that the brightness is not adjustable. The buttons are there on the screen but they don't actually do anything I would recommend it as a gift, sure, but ASUS could have improved this design.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for Later Surface Pro models
customer_reviews.text: What isn’t explained is that not suitable for later Surface Pros as they have no power through their ports, so sadly have to return it and buy a powered monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Great for productivity on the road
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my 11 inch Macbook Air, and after downloading the DisplayLink drivers from the website the monitor works perfectly. Power comes straight from a single USB port, and the screen is sharp. Cast of the picture is a little more blue than by Macbook screen, but the brightness is good. Obviously this will add a little bulk and weight to my laptop bag, but overall this is a great product, which will be invaluable for coding and spreadsheet work whilst on the road.
customer_reviews.author: C. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I was so worried about it’s compatibility but it worked for both my Mac (purchased in 2015) and Lenovo (similar age to Mac).
customer_reviews.author: Quma

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy to edit photos
customer_reviews.text: It’s generally good so far, except the colour accuracy, which it utterly abysmal. It is impossible to get anything like an acceptable picture on it never mind an actually good one. The picture is sharp and even and hideous due to the truly awful colours.
customer_reviews.author: Daz C

customer_reviews.title: My gripes are the less than sturdy stand and plastic body but overall it's a good ...
customer_reviews.text: Works on my Intel NUC6i7KYK small form factor PC either as a single or dual monitor setup via the combined Thunderbolt 3 / DP 1.2 USB-C port. I was pleasantly surprised to find that it worked straight out of the box without the need to install additional drivers with the Arch Linux operating system. My gripes are the less than sturdy stand and plastic body but overall it's a good piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Best buy (and worst !!)  I've made in years :)
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to install and you're up and running in couple of minutes. Lightweight and fits easily into the "sleeve" on my laptop bag. You don't even know you're carrying it! I use Windows 10 so, unlike some other comments, this is NOT an issue. My working day has now become more productive with dual screen environment. Terrific display and worth every penny. Update 14th June 2016 ================== Bloody thing's broke now !! Poor USB connectors on the screen!! Great when it worked and now costing me an additional £24 to buy a replacement as the monitor is not in stock at Amazon any more :( Amazon need to take responsibility for this instead of hiding behind red-tape !!
customer_reviews.author: Advent7

customer_reviews.title: Very good. Only downside is an inability to adjust the colour profile.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Excellent 'road warrior' kit. WIndows 10 finds the driver automatically. Negative points: (1) cannot set or adjust the colour profile for a 'display link' monitor such as this, hence missing some grey shades and cannot correct this. (2) the ASUS support software - as opposed to the drivers - abort out when they run and do not work; which for a company like ASUS indicates a lack of quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent project. As a consultant who frequently works without a permanent desk, this is excellent as a second screen. The screen doesn't require a separate power source, which is the best part. The monitor resolution is perfectly fine for normal office work.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lambourn

customer_reviews.title: Nice size but lags
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice looking screen and great size - really light, however using with a MacBook Pro 15' (2017) the lag is terrible, it would be unusable as a main screen to do any kind of work on (graphics or coding). It only works for me as I have things on the screen that I need to view while working but I don't need to actually work on using mouse. Also intermittently if you have a folder open for example and you move your mouse back to your monitor it just whites out, then re-appears later.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Asus flop
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived quickly but was not compatible with what I needed it for. Will NOT work with any devices that require a HDMI port which is why I returned it. Disappointing after service from the seller
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. J. M. Boateng

customer_reviews.title: Great second monitor
customer_reviews.text: If like me your main PC is a laptop and you want a bit of extra screen space but don't want the power cables and a bulky desk top monitor on your kitchen table then this is the monitor for you.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dawes

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for productivity, but has its caveats
customer_reviews.text: I love this screen, it's really changed my mobile work setup. It's a bit pricey, so if resolution is not that important for your needs I would suggest maybe looking at the MB168. My biggest complaint is that you cannot set your colour calibration on this screen. It has quite a blue tint/cool temperature. When it's sitting side by side with my laptop which has more neutral colour calibration it's not that comfortable on the eyes. In my opinion this is a major flaw, and I may consider getting a different secondary monitor as a result
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Bell

customer_reviews.title: Not Mac compatible
customer_reviews.text: Not Mac compatible which is not stated in Amazon description
customer_reviews.author: James H. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, allows me to have two laptop screens without taking up loads of space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful for home working. Bought this so I could compare spreadsheets and documents, really happy with it. Easy to set up although found standing it in the case a bit tricky, got there in the end.
customer_reviews.author: clara

customer_reviews.title: Linux and Windows, no complains
customer_reviews.text: Works great on Linux and Windows. I have both the MB169B+ and MB169C+, since the Dell XPS 9570 only has a single USB-C. I recomend both screens (althoug 169C+ has more features, but B+ can work on older notebooks).
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic. I was a little concerned the image quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. I was a little concerned the image quality might not be all that great seeing as it is powered by USB. However, if anything the image is actually better than my laptop screen! There is the tiniest bit of input lag on the screen buy hardly noticeable, but it is there. A minor niggle is that case isn't all the great as a stand but it is perfectly functional, it is good enough. I could get a separate stand but then that is just something else that needs to be carried. Not worth knocking a star of for that though.
customer_reviews.author: Reubensis

customer_reviews.title: A great travel companion
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this monitor and already 2 of my colleagues are looking to buy them. Easy to set up and didn't even need the supplied cd. Stand a little tricky to figure out at first as the diagram isn't great but once you have done it once it is perfectly simple. The screen is actually larger than expected but after a quick panic I can report that in it's case, it will just fit in to a 17" laptop bag. Thought this may be helpful to know if you travel a lot like me
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: I was sceptical, and then amazed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a summer of travelling while web-developing. I was sceptical that a monitor powered purely by USB shouldn't be any good, but was brilliantly surprised. Probably not suitable for gaming or photo/video editing, but I have my main monitor for that. Great for browsing, writing text/code or watching video, and I actually prefer it to the powered/HDMI monitors in my client's office. The case also doubles as a very sturdy stand.
customer_reviews.author: Hussein Duvigneau

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with some laptops
customer_reviews.text: Am using Dell Latitude 3570. Struggled for two days but could not get it working. ASUs support then confirmed over chat that it’s not compatible. Disappointing. Had to return it and claim refund. Later ordered the Zen screen model , much more expensive. Yet to received.
customer_reviews.author: Sunil Jain

customer_reviews.title: best thing i got for my laptop
customer_reviews.text: best thing i got for my laptop, its for working from home, the thing i didnt realise though is that my laptop has a lower resolution than this screen, so i am not using it to the full potential. I would however like it to stay at full brightness all of the time, it seems to turn down brightness each time i turn it on. Makes my home office alot better!
customer_reviews.author: iamdarren

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great piece. I love the screen and even bought a second one :) . I only wish it was 4K and not Full HD. The touch is a bit funny on Mac at first but you get use to it very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected, don't buy if you like a bright/vivid screen
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'm not sure if this is normal for portable screens, but I didn't like the brightness of this one at all. At no chance this compares to a normal screen. Even the brightness in the max, I still have difficulties to see the screen. I tried multiple screen configurations, but it does not solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Martins

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and portable
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, portable external monitor, great for working away from home or office. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: flor

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: Screen arrived on time and in good condition. Very easy to set up and use, I just can't alter the brightness although there is a button on the side for that. It's very slim and the cover folds cleverly to provide a stable support.
customer_reviews.author: Boglaboll

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: A great item. A little bit tricky to install as I don't have a USB 3.0 port but I soon managed it and very happy with the monitor. Extremely lightweight and slim and excellent display. No issues with the cable despite previous reviews as it fits securely into both the monitor and the USB port on my laptop. Glad I went for the more expensive Asus monitor with the improved HD display.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Driver installation fails
customer_reviews.text: Installation failed and as my friend had the same display I contacted her and she sent me the driver. I now have it working. You would have had it back otherwise as with the last one that failed to install. It was just lucky my friend had this model.
customer_reviews.author: LAT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect almost.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product and invention. It’s portable, just one wire required l, no drivers nothing. It works perfectly fine. The picture quality is good for this price. The only drawback is that the brightness buttons don’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Daim

customer_reviews.title: Good screen but not the wire or stand
customer_reviews.text: The screen is great lightweight but the only complaint I have about the the item is that the the USB type-c port wire is a little bit too short but for the screen size brightness is good but the cover to use as a stand is not good at all look for s small cheep stand that will hold it up perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Noel Greene

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for a working from home essential
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the Asus monitor for extending my laptop screen to view two applications at once. If you are looking for a high resolution screen then this lower budget option is probably not for you, but for using MS Office, Outlook, Jira, Teams etc. on a daily basis, I would recommend it as a useful and great value solution.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing screen!
customer_reviews.text: What am amazing screen! Look it's not as clear or bright as my Surface Book 2 but why would it be for the cost. It is however super light, thin and transportable and given the single point type-c connectivity and power configuration, it's a dream for fast setup. I can't recommend this enough and the Amazon delivery was speedy as ever!
customer_reviews.author: Marshall S.

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality but did the job, until it cracked in transit
customer_reviews.text: Screen was a bit dim, and the connection was a little shaky and so easily damageable. The carrying case also not up to the job. Screen is now cracked and unuseable after one journey in a suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: On windows 7 operating system works very well where sharpness colours and brightness is excellent. ASUS need to develop driver t
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't yet support Windows 10. On windows 7 operating system works very well where sharpness colours and brightness are excellent. ASUS need to develop driver to support windows10. Update: Asus released the Windows 10 driver recently. It works very well with surface pro 3 with docking station. However, I recommend that you use a "y" cable instead of the single connector because the screens need more power.
customer_reviews.author: NAli

customer_reviews.title: Monitor is great, stand needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: It’s light and requires no setup. The stand/case is poorly made- it’s hard to get the monitor in it or configure the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not great product, missing advertised Case/Stand.
customer_reviews.text: Firstly the product didn't come with the advertised case/stand, which has made it very difficult to use and carry round! The cable that powers it and connects it to the computer falls out constantly (and seems to have a lot of trouble syncing with the computer again), and, when using it as a primary screen I have to restart the computer a couple of times before it connects.
customer_reviews.author: Joss Holden-Rea

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing screen quality
customer_reviews.text: A lot less bright and sharp than I had expected. Overall was giving me tired eyes within a day.
customer_reviews.author: Cristiano Betta

customer_reviews.title: Handy Second Screen.
customer_reviews.text: Nice lightweight, thin & attractive monitor. Easy enough to set up and works a treat. Display not cutting edge quality but for everyday use it is fine. Not used for challenging tasks so can't advise on the performance when it needs to work hard. Case used as a stand is a bit of a let down though.
customer_reviews.author: Corky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and very portable
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant portable monitor. I got mine from Amazon warehouse. Very happy with the picture quality and the fact that everything can work off a single USB cable—perfect! It is also very slim and lightweight. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rajiv S.

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and pretty good picture quality. Only bugbear is having to turn up screen brightness everyone it's plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: USB type-C... if you're lucky
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Turns out, although I have a USB-C socket on my laptop, it's not the riiight kiind of USB-C socket. Silly me. Didn't realise I'd have to become an overnight electronics genius to be able to guess whether this would be compatible or not.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Buchan

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The screen worked perfectly fine for the first 3 months, however suddenly it stopped picking up my computer's display. The screen would power on, show a message stating there was 'No Display Found' and then power off. I tried changing the cable but it didn't make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Areeb Siddiqui

product_meta.title: ASUS ZenScreen Touch MB16AMT Portable Monitor, 15.6-Inch, IPS, Full HD, 10-Point Touch, Built-in Battery, Hybrid Signal Solution, USB Type-C, Micro-HDMI, For Laptops, Smartphones, Consoles and Cameras
